title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 25)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A condo at 246 Main St. #6, Acton sold for $450,000; it offers 1,040 sq ft, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths.
A historic 1850s one-family home at 486 Main St., Amesbury, with 1,771 sq ft, sold for $880,000.
A high-rise condo at 1 Dalton St. #5301, Boston, featuring 4,064 sq ft and 4 bedrooms, sold for $14,000,000.

title: How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored?
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Over 100,000 customers in Eastern Massachusetts lost power due to a blizzard, with some restorations delayed until later this week.
Eversource and National Grid are working to restore power; 220,000 Eversource and 94,000 National Grid customers initially affected.
High winds and blizzard conditions hampered efforts; crews were pre-positioned in hard-hit areas like Cape Cod and Nantucket.

title: 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots hold 11 picks, including the 31st, in the 2026 NFL Draft.
Top prospects KC Concepcion, Zion Young, and Kenyon Sadiq identified as potential targets for the Patriots in the draft.
Patriots aim to upgrade roster with potential additions at wide receiver, edge rusher, and tight end positions.

title: Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A Malden school employee has been placed on administrative leave due to a serious incident involving a high school student.
Police are investigating the incident, which happened outside working hours; no arrests or charges have been made.
The employee works at Linden STEAM Academy, serving K-8 students; details of the incident remain undisclosed.

title: These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A historic snowstorm has closed several Massachusetts school districts for a third day, impacting the South Shore and South Coast.
School closures for Feb. 25 include Attleboro, Brockton, and Quincy, with delays in Canton and Wrentham.
The snowstorm left some areas with three feet of snow, prompting extended closures for safety and cleanup.

title: MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA service largely returns to normal Wednesday, except the Fall River/New Bedford line operating on a modified schedule.
The modified Commuter Rail schedule is due to severe storm impacts in the South Coast region.
MBTA advises riders to plan for extra travel time and stay updated via T-Alerts or the MBTA Go app.

title: Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots uncertain if Stefon Diggs will return; $26.5M cap hit complicates his future with the team.
Diggs' contract includes $1.7M guaranteed, with potential $6M bonus if on roster by March 13.
Tom E. Curran suggests Patriots might seek younger, cheaper talent to potentially replace Diggs.

title: Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: House Minority Whip Katherine Clark and other Massachusetts representatives will skip Trump's State of the Union address.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley and Sen. Ed Markey will participate in a rally and focus on immigration issues.
Rep. Lori Trahan criticizes Trump's policies, emphasizing legislation priorities over attending ceremonial events.

title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman's return to the Bruins is uncertain after celebrating Olympic gold with Team USA.
Boston Bruins face Columbus Blue Jackets Thursday, holding the final playoff spot with a 32-20-5 record.
Weather-related travel delays diverted Team USA's return flight, affecting McAvoy and Swayman's availability.

title: Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots face uncertainty at offensive tackle after a Super Bowl LX loss to Seattle.
San Francisco's Trent Williams may enter free agency if contract talks falter, offering potential for Patriots.
Williams would be a significant but costly short-term upgrade to New England's offensive line needs.
